title: Adrian Munoz case log

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Adrian Munoz case log
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

In the interest of transparency, I respectfully request a log detailing every case handled by investigator Adrian Munoz during his tenure at the Los Angeles County Medical Examiner’s office. This request is made in light of his dismissal in 2023 for theft of belongings from the deceased. Mr. Munoz worked at the office from 2018 until his termination. Please include the case numbers, decedent names, dates of birth, and the dates of birth of all decedents listed in the log.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Cassie Sipe

title: Chad Bianco Jetset Lifestyle

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Chad Bianco Jetset Lifestyle
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Hello, 

I am requesting records related to Sheriff Chad Bianco's travels to Washington DC or any political event where he traveled to give a speech or be a guest. This includes anyone from the department who has accompanied him. 

Records related include:
Expenses: receipts, filed expense reports associated with traveling (including flights, transportation, security, food) 
Days of vacation used, or whether vacation time was used whatsoever
Itineraries and calendars related to his travels

Search 2020 through 2024

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Joey Scott

Pursuant to California Government Code § 7922.535, staff will review your request and respond within 10 days to notify you if there are responsive records, or if an extension is necessary to determine if responsive records exist.  If your request was received after business hours or on a weekend or holiday, the next business day will be considered the date of receipt. The 10-day response period starts with the first calendar day after the date of receipt. (Civ. Code § 10.)  You may be contacted by the department if there are questions regarding your request. 
 
PLEASE NOTE: The California Public Records Act (CPRA) does not require a governmental body to create new information, to do legal research, or to answer questions.

Riverside County Sheriff's Department

Dear Joey Scott: 
On January 21, 2025, the Riverside County Sheriff's Office received your request for records under the California Public Records Act (CPRA) wherein you requested the following: "To Whom It May Concern: 

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records: 

Hello, 

I am requesting records related to Sheriff Chad Bianco's travels to Washington DC or any political event where he traveled to give a speech or be a guest. This includes anyone from the department who has accompanied him. 

Records related include: 
1.  Expenses: receipts, filed expense reports associated with traveling (including flights, transportation, security, food) 
2.  Days of vacation used, or whether vacation time was used whatsoever Itineraries and calendars related to his travels 

Search 2020 through 2024 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. 

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Friverside-county-sheriff-806%252Fchad-bianco-jetset-lifestyle-180147%252F%253Femail%253Driversidesheriff%252540govqa.us&url_auth_token=AAAwWvHjyJiP2QkdYxMb_PTb0Ec%3A1taQZ5%3AoJnaL6eCA3hzSzTI2h8VMSBiVgA4gRgokBipIiTgbdk" 
The above request was numbered for ease of reference. 
Item #1: 
The Riverside County Sheriff's Office has reviewed its files and located records responsive to your request.  Please log into your online account to access the information. 
Please Note: 
While the records requested were released to you, however, the Riverside County Sheriff’s Office has redacted information for privacy reasons. Courts have allowed redactions for such reasons. 
Where non-disclosable portions of public records are “reasonably segregable” from the disclosable portions, the agency may withhold or redact the non-disclosable portions while producing the disclosable portions. Thus, redactions are permitted under the CPRA, as long as the basis for the redaction (specified exemption) is identified in the agency’s response. See Cal. Gov. Code § 7922.525 (a)-(b); American Civ. Liberties Union Found’n v. Deukmejian (1982) 32 Cal.3d 440, 452-454. 
The following exemptions were asserted: 

Government Code § 7927.705 - read in conjunction with Evidence Code § 1040, provides that official information acquired in confidence by a public employee is exempt from disclosure. 

Government Code § 7927.705 - read in conjunction with Article 1, § 1 of the California Constitution provides that personal information details are subject to privacy rights that make such information exempt from disclosure. 

Government Code § 7922.000 - the records in question are exempt because under the facts of the particular case the public interest served by not disclosing the record clearly outweighs the public interest served by disclosure of the record. 
Item #2: 
The Riverside County Sheriff's Office has reviewed its files and no records responsive to your request were located. 

Please consider this CPRA request closed. 
Sincerely, 

Corr. Sergeant Victoria Miara 
CPRA Unit 
Riverside County Sheriff's Office

title: CO County CVR Request (Office of the Clerk and Recorder)

communications.subject: Colorado Open Records Act Request: CO County CVR Request (Office of the Clerk and Recorder)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Colorado Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Cast vote record (CVR) data for the following elections:
1. 2022 Nov Midterm Election
2. 2024 Nov General Election

Specifically, I’m looking for the full anonymized record of votes cast each election generated by the voting system. An example of these records in REDACTED format is available at this link on the Arapahoe County webpage: https://www.arapahoevotes.gov/transparency
If you follow the "Redacted Cast Vote Record (CVR)" link on that webpage, it will download a csv file with Arapahoe County's redacted CVR records (this: https://gis.arapahoegov.com/dl_data/cr_voter_data/redacted_cvr/REDACTED_CVR_Export_20241126111830_330948.zip.) 

I am requesting these records NOT redacted pursuant to the Colorado Open Records Act. Please let me know if you need any further clarification on the type of data that I am requesting.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Aleksandra Conevska

communications.subject: CORA Response
communications.communication:
Greetings,

The election results you've requested can be located on our website:

  *   2024 Election Data<https://www.denvergov.org/media/denverapps/electionarchives/2024/General%20Election/Modified_CVR_Export_20241114153740.csv>
  *   2022 Election Data<https://www.denvergov.org/media/denverapps/electionarchives/2022/General%20Election/2022%20Denver%20General%20Election%20CVR%20Data.csv>

You will see that the data is not redacted as Colorado law states that if we had a precinct/style return fewer than ten ballots we are required to redact that info. That was not the case in either election.

Please note that both links will take you to a direct Excel download of the data.

Please let me know if you have additional questions.

Mikayla Ortega
Marketing & Communications Manager
Denver Office of the Clerk and Recorder I Hon. Paul Lopez

title: Presidential Transition Team EPA Information

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Presidential Transition Team EPA Information
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Documentation pertaining to the initial strategic planning and informational resources in direct support of the official transition protocols for the Presidential Transition between Former President Joe Biden and President Donald Trump. Particularly, materials encompassing all preparatory documentation and presentation materials created for the Transition Team representatives during November and December 2024.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jordan Eisen

Particularly, materials encompassing all preparatory documentation and presentation materials created for the Transition Team representatives during November and December 2024.    The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.    In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. title: Sally Mann artwork seized by police -- Judge Tim O'Hare

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: Sally Mann artwork seized by police -- Judge Tim O'Hare
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. Any communications sent to or from Tim O'Hare on or after December 1, 2024, which concerns or mentions the Modern Art Museum of Fort Worth, including (but not limited to) any communications containing any of the following terms: Museum, Sally, Mann, pornography, porn, indecent, decent, decency.

2. Any communications between Tim O'Hare and the Modern Art Museum of Fort Worth on or after December 1, 2024.

Please note that this request seeks public records wherever they may be found, including on devices or networks owned or operated by private parties. For example, if an employee uses a personal cell phone or social media account to conduct public business, records created, maintained, or held on the phone or account are public records subject to this request.

"Communications" means and includes emails, text messages, social media messages, letters, memoranda, calendar entries, chats, or any other form of one-to-one or one-to-many communication.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

communications.subject: Tarrant County Criminal District Attorney's Office - Records Request CDA-2025-99 Clarification Requested
communications.communication:
RE: Request Number Request Number: CDA-2025-99 Submitted on: 1/13/2025 
  
 Dear Adam Steinbaugh, 
  
 For the County to continue to process your request for records, we require additional information. 
  
 In an effort to provide our department with clearer instruction to conduct an accurate and complete search in response to your request, we kindly seek additional clarification and narrowing. 
  
 A search may be conducted using certain key terms or phrases such that if the specific key term or phrase appears (such as in an email), that communication would be retrieved and would populate in the search results. In part 1 of your request, we understand that you have already listed some key terms and phrases as follows: 
  
 "Museum" 
 "Sally" 
 "Mann" 
 "pornography" 
 "porn" 
 "indecent" 
 "decent" 
 "decency" 
  
 However, also in part 1 of your request, you have language, "which concerns or mentions the Modern art Museum of Fort Worth." In order to ensure that the relevant and responsive emails you are seeking populate in the search using key terms, would you consider adding additional key terms in lieu of this language? For example, in addition to key terms/phrases 1-8 above, our suggestion is that you might add the following key terms / phrases: 
  
 9. "Modern Art" 
  
 10. "Modern Art Museum" 
  
 11. "Modern Art Museum of Fort Worth" 
  
 12. "Museum of Fort Worth" 
  
 12. "Fort Worth Museum" 
  
 Also, would you omit the phrase "including (but not limited to)" in part 1 as to allow the key terms to operate as intended to limit the search to those key terms/phrases? 
  
 Would you be agreeable to the modifications and narrowing above? 
  
 Item 1 lists Tim O'Hare as one of the subjects of the communications but does not list any other individual to whom those communications were engaged with. Item 2 lists Tim O'Hare and "the Modern art Museum of Fort Worth" but does not list individuals. Would you be able to provide names, job titles, email addresses, etc. of other individuals of whom Judge O'Hare would have potentially had communications with so that our search may be limited to communications between Judge O'Hare and those individuals? 
  
 We hope that you are able to provide some clarification and narrowing so that we may streamline the request to the items you are seeking without unnecessarily generating additional cost or labor. 
  
 Per Texas Government Code section 552.222, if a written response to this request for clarification or narrowing is not received within 61 days, your request is considered withdrawn. 
  
 Please respond to all when responding to these emails to ensure that our staff sees your responses. 
  
 Description of records requested: 
  
 To Whom It May Concern: Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records: 1. Any communications sent to or from Tim O'Hare on or after December 1, 2024, which concerns or mentions the Modern Art Museum of Fort Worth, including (but not limited to) any communications containing any of the following terms: Museum, Sally, Mann, pornography, porn, indecent, decent, decency. 2. Any communications between Tim O'Hare and the Modern Art Museum of Fort Worth on or after December 1, 2024. Please note that this request seeks public records wherever they may be found, including on devices or networks owned or operated by private parties. For example, if an employee uses a personal cell phone or social media account to conduct public business, records created, maintained, or held on the phone or account are public records subject to this request. "Communications" means and includes emails, text messages, social media messages, letters, memoranda, calendar entries, chats, or any other form of one-to-one or one-to-many communication. The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires. Sincerely, 
  
 Thank you, 
 Tarrant County Criminal District Attorney's Office 
 401 W. Belknap
Fort Worth, Texas 76196 
 (817) 884-1233 
 openrecords@tarrantcountytx.gov 
 __________________________________________________________________________________ 
 Powered by

Best,

communications.subject: Re: RE: Texas Public Information Act Request #CDA-2025-99
communications.communication:
Dear Requestor Adam Steinbaugh, 
  
 Thank you for your written response received on January 28, 2025. 
  
 After reviewing your response, there are still a few areas of your request that may need additional clarification and narrowing, if possible, in order to conduct a more precise and cost-efficient search. 
  
 So far, based on your response, the following is what you are seeking currently: 
  
 1. Any communications sent to or from Judge Tim O'Hare on or after December 1, 2024, containing any of the following key terms: 
  
 1. "Museum"
2. "Sally"
3. "Mann"
4. "pornography"
5. "porn"
6. "indecent"
7. "decent"
8. "decency"
9. "Modern Art"
10. "Modern Art Museum"
11. "Modern Art Museum of Fort Worth"
12. "Museum of Fort Worth"
13. "Fort Worth Museum" 
  
 2. Emails between Judge Tim O'Hare and any individual email address containing "themodern.org" in the email address (domain) on or after December 1, 2024. 
  
 The following are additional areas in which we seek additional clarification and narrowing. 
  
 For Item 1: 
  
 Would you also like to narrow the "communications" down to only emails as you did in item 2? 
 Would you provide a list of individuals to include in the search as either sender or recipient of communications (or just emails) to and from Judge Tim O'Hare? 
  
 For Item 2: 
  
 Would you be able to provide a list of key terms as you did in item 1? We could use the same key terms list from item 1 for the search in item 2 if you wish. If you have other key terms in mind, please list them out for item 2. 
  
 We hope that you can provide additional clarification and narrowing as to the 3 highlighted areas discussed above. 
  
 Per Texas Government Code section 552.222, if a written response to this request for clarification or narrowing is not received within 61 days, your request is considered withdrawn.

Please respond to all when responding to these emails to ensure that our staff sees your responses.

Original Description of records requested:

To Whom It May Concern: Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records: 1. Any communications sent to or from Tim O'Hare on or after December 1, 2024, which concerns or mentions the Modern Art Museum of Fort Worth, including (but not limited to) any communications containing any of the following terms: Museum, Sally, Mann, pornography, porn, indecent, decent, decency. 2. Any communications between Tim O'Hare and the Modern Art Museum of Fort Worth on or after December 1, 2024. Please note that this request seeks public records wherever they may be found, including on devices or networks owned or operated by private parties. For example, if an employee uses a personal cell phone or social media account to conduct public business, records created, maintained, or held on the phone or account are public records subject to this request. "Communications" means and includes emails, text messages, social media messages, letters, memoranda, calendar entries, chats, or any other form of one-to-one or one-to-many communication. The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes. In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not. Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires. Sincerely,

communications.subject: RE: Texas Public Information Act Request #CDA-2025-99
communications.communication:
Hello --

For Item 1, I do not want to limit it to emails. I think it is sufficient to seek all communications containing those terms, given that the request is limited to a narrow timeframe.

For Item 2, I do not want to limit it to particular terms, as the potential number of users on that domain is quite small.

Thank you,

Adam Steinbaugh

communications.subject: Tarrant County District Attorney's Office - District Attorney's Office Public Information Act Request CDA-2025-99 Redaction Acknowledgment
communications.communication:
Dear Requestor, 
  
 The Tarrant County District Attorney’s Office is in receipt of your request. There are some pieces of information in the requested documents that are generally considered excepted from public release or confidential and which we would seek your agreement to redact or withhold. These include, but are not limited to, dates of birth, social security numbers, driver’s license numbers, license plates, VINs, medical records, attorney work product, email addresses of members of the public (private citizens who are not County employees) pursuant to Texas Government Code 552.137(a), and family member information of public employees pursuant to Texas Government Code 552.1175 and 552.024. 
  
 If you are agreeable to allowing this office to withhold information that is not subject to public release, please reply to this e-mail letting us know. We will then begin copying the records you’ve requested. 
  
 If you do not agree, we will have to request a ruling from the Office of the Attorney General regarding these records. This will likely take several months and will mean that we cannot release any of the requested records until the Attorney General issues a ruling. If you would like us to request a ruling, please reply providing a mailing address where the Attorney General can send you correspondence. 
  
 Please let us know whether you agree to the redactions or if you would prefer that we seek a ruling. 
  
 You are welcome to call the open records team regarding your request if you have any questions. We can be reached at (817)884-1233. 
  
 Thank you, 
 Tarrant County District Attorney's Office 
 401 W. Belknap
Fort Worth, Texas 76196

title: Request to NASA for list of 2018 film and TV collaborations

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Request to NASA for list of 2018 film and TV collaborations
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

A list of all documentaries, feature films, and TV programs supported in any way by NASA in the year 2018. NASA has previously released such lists of media collaborations for other years, including to this requester, who has made them public.

I am the Director of Research Operations at a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization called The Decoding Culture Foundation. These documents will be used for public education and research purposes. I therefore request a waiver of all fees that may otherwise apply. Attached is a document with organization letterhead confirming my position, as well as the organization's 501(c)(3) application and approval form.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brett Carollo

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #24-01184-F-HQ
communications.communication:
This message concerns FOIA request 24-01184-F-HQ.

I am writing to appeal the rejection of my request for a fee waiver. This request was rejected on the grounds that I could not demonstrate that disclosure of the requested records to me would constitute a "significant" benefit to public knowledge of NASA'a activities. Specifically, my claim was characterized as "speculative." In considering my appeal, I ask whomever it may concern to consider that, in addition to my qualifications as stated in the original request, I am the editor-in-chief of a magazine (currently digital but soon to be in print) called "Cultural Engineering Studies," and I personally contributed an article to this magazine on NASA's relationship to Hollywood--an almost unexplored topic. So it seems arbitrary to conclude that this information will not benefit public awareness in a "significant" way. 

Thank you in advance for considering my appeal,

Brett Carollo

title: Strategic Communication Overview

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Strategic Communication Overview
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Briefing titled "Strategic Communication Overview", presented by Sue Gough, Acting Director of Joint Communication, DASD (JC), OSD Public Affairs, on July 29, 2009.

This briefing is cited in ADA525371, "Commander’s Handbook for Strategic Communication and Communication Strategy", published June 24, 2010.

Please provide a copy of the presentation slides and any associated written materials. If no slides exist, I request any available summary, memorandum, or transcript related to the briefing.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Bill Gagnon

title: Chief FOIA officer's recent email (United States Secret Service)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Chief FOIA officer's recent email (United States Secret Service)
communications.communication:
Dear United States Secret Service,

On behalf of myself and Fiat Fiendum, I hereby request the following records:

1. The one email in your chief FOIA officer's email inbox or equivalent which was received nearest and before October 19, 2024, midnight Eastern time, regardless of subject matter.
2. The one email in your chief FOIA officer's email spam folder or equivalent which was received nearest and before October 19, 2024, midnight Eastern time, regardless of subject matter.
3. The one email in your chief FOIA officer's sent email folder or equivalent which was sent nearest and before October 19, 2024, midnight Eastern time, regardless of subject matter.
4. The total full-time equivalent count of people who work for your FOIA office as of October 19, 2024.

This request is expressly limited to United States Secret Service's own FOIA office. Please do not refer it to any other agency or division. This request is expressly not a Privacy Act request, and no PA waiver will be provided.

Please provide the email records in EML, Maildir, MBOX, MIX, MSG, or PST format only — not PDF, Word, image, etc — including all metadata (e.g. full email headers as received/sent) and attachments, without alteration other than narrowly tailored electronic redaction of specifically claimed exemptions that do not affect any part of non exempt information (and, in particular, without rasterization).

Please provide the fourth record as a statement in your response letter, or at your option, as the most readily available record, in original electronic format as currently stored on your computer systems, which includes that information.

Please provide all records either as individual files, or as an unencrypted ZIP file, uploaded to MuckRock. Do not apply any encryption, DRM, or other restriction.

I request fee waiver, because
* Fiat Fiendum is a 501(c)(3) non-profit;
* this request is for public interest, non-commercial purposes;
* these records would give a snapshot of insight into the everyday processes of FOIA offices; and
* these records are being requested in order to conduct a government-wide audit of agencies' FOIA compliance.

In the event that you deny fee waiver, please process this request as-is, because I will not agree to any fees.

Please be sure to provide:
* 5 USC 552(a)(6)(A)(i)(II) FOIA Public Liaison information
* 5 USC 552(a)(6)(A)(i)(III)(aa) appeal information
* 5 USC 552(a)(6)(A)(i)(III)(bb) OGIS information
* 5 USC 552(a)(7)(A) tracking number
* 5 USC 552(a)(7)(B)(ii) completion ETA

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,
Sai
President, Fiat Fiendum, Inc.

P.S. Sai is my full legal name.

title: Axon Draft One Records (City of Fort Collins Police Department)

communications.subject: Colorado Open Records Act Request: Axon Draft One Records (City of Fort Collins Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Colorado Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records related to the use of any AI-assisted police report technology provided by the company Axon (previously known as Taser). This technology may be referred to as Draft One (https://www.axon.com/products/draft-one), the Axon Narrative Assistant, or by another name. 

For more information on the Axon Narrative Assistant, please refer to the User Guide found at this link: https://www.documentcloud.org/documents/25418151-axon-narrative-assistant-user-guide_axon-records-1-1/. 

For more information on Axon Draft One, please look at this page on the Axon website: https://www.axon.com/resources/closer-look-draft-one. 

CONTRACT AND AGREEMENTS

1.  All contracts, memorandums of understanding, and any other written agreements between this agency and Axon related to the use of Draft One, Narrative Assistant, or any other AI-assisted report generation tool provided by Axon. 

Responsive records include all associated amendments, exhibits, and supplemental and supporting documentation. 

If access to Draft One or similar tools is being provided via an existing contract or through an informal agreement, please provide the relevant contract or the relevant communication or agreement that facilitated the access. This includes all agreements, both formal and informal, including all trial access, even if that access does not or did not involve financial obligations. 

2. All relevant terms of use, licensing agreements, and any other guiding materials;

TRAINING, POLICIES and USE MATERIAL

3. All training materials relevant to Draft One or Axon Narrative Assistant generated by this agency; 

4. All training material provided by Axon to this agency regarding its use of Draft One; 

5. All user manuals, other guidance materials, help documents, or related materials;

6. Guides, safety tests, and other supplementary material that mention Draft One provided by Axon from January 1, 2024 and the date this request is received;

7. All final reports, evaluations, reports, or other documentation concluding or summarizing a trial or evaluation period or pilot project; 

8. Any and all policies related to the use of Draft One, the Narrative Assistant, or any other AI-assisted report generation offerings provided by Axon (An example of one such policy can be found here: https://cdn.muckrock.com/foia_files/2024/11/26/608_Computer_Software_and_Transcription-Assisted_Report_Generation.pdf);


COMMUNICATIONS
9. All communications sent or received by any representative of this agency with individuals representing Axon referencing the following term, including emails and attachments: 
• Draft One
• Narrative Assistant
• AI-generated report

10. All communications sent to or received by any representative of this agency with each of the following email addresses, including attachments:
a. draftone@axon.com
b. bryan@axon.com
c. noahsw@axon.com               	 
d. efleischli@axon.com (Erin Fleischli)
e. edriver@axon.com
f. eforester@axon.com (Evan Forester, Director of Product Marketing)    
g. gsigman@axon.com (Gabriel Sigman, Technical Account Manager)   	

We ask that these materials be provided on a rolling basis; as your office collects and reviews records, we would appreciate it if your office would provide those materials to us incrementally. If possible, please provide any responsive contractual and financial materials within the statutorily-mandated public record law time frame. We would prefer communications to be provided next. Please contact us for further discussion regarding the search and release of these materials.

This request is not being made for commercial purposes. Please assess fees appropriately in accordance with a public records request being made in the public interest.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform us of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I request that all records be disclosed in their native, digital format and transmitted to us electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or by CD-ROM if not.

If you need any more information in order to process the request, or cannot process a portion of the request for any reason, please respond to the email address on this request or “aos@eff.org”. Further discussion may be conducted via email. Please let us know if a phone call will be necessary or desirable; such contact information will be provided upon request.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires business days.

Sincerely, 
Jesse Cabrera
Research Assistant

Beryl Lipton 
Senior Investigative Researcher

Dave Maass
Director of Investigations

Electronic Frontier Foundation

title: Tewksbury PD School Based Arrests

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Tewksbury PD School Based Arrests
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

To whoever it may concern: 
 
This letter constitutes a request pursuant to the Public Records Act, M. G. L.c.66, §10, for public records in the custody of your police department.
Under the Criminal Justice Reform Act, school districts and law enforcement agencies must “specify the manner and division of responsibility for collecting and reporting the school-based arrests, citations and court referrals of students to the Department of Elementary and Secondary Education” (DESE). DESE began collecting data on school-related arrests in the 2018-19 school year. In the 2019-20 school year, DESE has expanded that collection to include data on all referrals to law enforcement. DESE has defined these terms as follows, borrowing the same definitions used by the U.S. Department of Education since its 2009 Civil Rights Data Collection. 
A school-related arrest “[r]efers to an arrest of a student for any activity conducted on school grounds, during off campus school activities (including while taking school transportation), or due to a referral by any school official. All school-related arrests are considered referrals to law enforcement.” 
A referral to law enforcement “[i]s an action by which a student is reported to any law enforcement agency or official, including a school police unit, for an incident that occurs on school grounds, during school-related events, or while taking school transportation, regardless of whether official action is taken. Citations, tickets, court referrals, and school-related arrests are considered referrals to law enforcement.” 
 
I request the following public records, as defined in M. G. L.c. 4, § 7 (twenty-sixth): 
 
1. An extract of your records management system or database that includes each school-related arrest and each referral to law enforcement conducted during the 2018-2019, 2019-2020, 2020-2021, 2021-2022, and 2022-2023 school year (up until the day the records are produced). Specifically, we request an extract of the database to include the following columns: 
a. Date of arrest or referral to law enforcement 
b. Time of arrest or referral to law enforcement 
c. Charge (or charges) 
d. Whether the individual(s) was arrested or referred to law enforcement 
e. Sex of individual(s) arrested or referred to law enforcement 
f. Age of individual(s) arrested or referred to law enforcement 
g. Race of individual(s) arrested or referred to law enforcement 
h. Ethnicity of individual(s) arrested or referred to law enforcement 
i. Disability status of the individual(s) arrested or referred to law enforcement 
j. Whether the individual arrested or referred to law enforcement is a student at the school.
k. Name of arresting officer, if applicable, and 
l. Badge number of the arresting officer or the officer that referred the youth to law enforcement, as applicable. 
 
2. If such an extract of the database in question 1 is not possible, please provide police reports and school incident reports on each school-related arrest conducted during the 2018-2019, 2019-2020, 2020-2021, 2021-2022, and 2022-2023 school year (up until the day the records are produced). 
 
3. Please provide an unduplicated count of arrested students for each school year including 2018-2019, 2019-2020, 2020-2021, 2021-2022, and 2022-2023 school year (up until the day the records are produced). 
 
4. If such an extract of the database in question 1 is not possible, please provide police reports and school incident reports on each referral to law enforcement conducted during the 2018-2019, 2019-2020, 2020-2021, 2021-2022, and 2022-2023 school year (up until the day the records are produced), per the U.S. Department of Education’s Civil Rights Data Collection for that year. For each referral to law enforcement, please include the school, demographic, and incident information described in DESE’s School Safety and Discipline Report Data Handbook v. 20.0. 
 
5. Please also provide an unduplicated counts of referrals to law enforcement (as defined above) for each school year including 2018-2019, 2019-2020, 2020-2021, 2021-2022 and 2022-2023 school year (up until the day the records are produced).  
As this request involves a matter of public interest and will not be used for any commercial purpose, we ask that all fees associated with this request be waived pursuant to 950 C.M.R. 32.07(2)(k). The purpose of this request is to determine whether your school district and police department are complying with their reporting obligations under the Criminal Justice Reform Act. “The public has an interest in knowing whether public servants are carrying out their duties in an efficient and law-abiding manner.” 
 
It would be ill-advised to impose a fee for data that your police department may have failed to report in violation of statutory and regulatory duty. Moreover, as you know, municipalities with a population of over 20,000 may not assess a fee for the first 2 hours of time spent searching for, compiling, segregating, redacting and reproducing a requested record. Finally, pursuant to 950 C.M.R. 32.07(2)(i), a records access officer shall assess no fee greater than the lowest hourly rate of a person capable of compiling, segregating, redacting and reproducing a requested record. In the event that a charge is incurred for this request which you will not waive, please so indicate and include an itemization of estimated good faith costs. 
Please provide public records to a requestor in an electronic format unless the record is not available in an electronic format. M. G. L.c 66, § 6A(d). 
The Public Records Act requires that you comply with this request within ten (10) business days following receipt. If you believe that documents or data responsive to any request herein is not public record and thus not subject to disclosure, please set forth in writing the specific reasons for such assertion, including the specific exemption or exemptions that you believe apply. To the extent that you determine that records need to be redacted in order to be produced under any law protecting the privacy of named individuals, please do so rather than withholding them in their entirety.
If you have any questions about this request, or need additional time to respond, please contact me. Thank you in advance for your prompt response to this request. 
 
Sincerely, 
Rylee Meints
J.D. Candidate
Research Assistant
Center for Public Interest, Advocacy, and Collaboration 
meints.r@northeastern.edu

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Rylee Meints

title: Child care provider data

communications.subject: Alabama Open Records Law Request: Child care provider data
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Alabama Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Historical data on all licensed child care providers (active and closed) from as far back as data systems will allow to present. I also request data on license-exempt providers, if available. Specifically, I request the following information as it is available:

1)	Provider name or ID
2)	Street number
3)	Street name
4)	City
5)	Zip code
6)	Licensed capacity for each year (by child age group if available)
7)	Enrollment for each year (by child age group if available)
8)	Provider type (e.g., center-based provider, home-based provider, Head Start, school-based pre-K, etc.) for each year
9)	First license issue (open) date
10)	Most recent license issue date
11)	Most recent license expiration date or close date
12)	Ages served for each year
13)	Hours of operation for each year
14)	QRIS rating for each year (please explain who is required to participate and whether there are financial supports based on rating)
15)	Accepts Child Care and Development Fund subsidies for each year
16)	Accepts other types of subsidies for each year (please list types)
17)	Prices for each year (by child age group if available)
18)	Violation records

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

André Natta, a citizen of Alabama, in coordination with Gabrielle Pepin.

title: EeeIEeeOhOrder

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

This is a request under the Freedom of Information Act.  I hereby request the following records:

Records associated with self inspection of classified materials handling pursuant to Executive Order (E.O.) 13526 and E.O. 13587 performed by the Department for the last ten (10) years. Please include results of inspection and especially guidance resulting from analysis of reviewed activities and materials. Inspection records associated with effectiveness of original classification, effectiveness of derivative classification, safeguarding material, security training, security violations, and auditing / oversight are specifically requested. Thank you!

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that fees cannot be waived, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM, DVD-R, or BD-R if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Martin Peck
An acknowledgement letter, stating the request is being processed.

communications.subject: JMD FOIA Request 105661 Acknowledgement (Intranet Quorum IMA00114575)
communications.communication:
June 1, 2016

 

Mr. Martin Peck              

MuckRock News 
Dept MR 21358 
P.O.  Box 55819 
MA 02205

 

Re: Referral from NSD of a request for records associated with
self-inspection of classified materials handling performed by the DOJ
for the last six (6) years including results of inspection and guidance
resulting from analysis.

 

JMD FOIA TRACKING NUMBER: 105661

 

Dear Mr. Peck:

 

I am writing on behalf of the Justice Management Division (JMD) of the
U.S. Department of Justice (DOJ) to acknowledge receipt of your Freedom
of Information (FOIA) request on 05/02/2016.

 

Your request was referred to JMD by the . Their identifying tracking
number was . 

 

For your information, the Justice Management Division assigns incoming
requests to one of three tracks:  simple, complex, or expedited.   Each
request is then handled on a first-in, first-out basis in relation to
other requests in the same track.  Simple requests usually receive a
response in approximately one month whereas complex requests
necessarily take longer.  At this time, your request has been assigned
to the Complex track. 

 

If you have a question about the status of your FOIA request, you may
contact this office by emailing JMDFOIA@usdoj.gov
<mailto:JMDFOIA@usdoj.gov>  or by calling 202-514-3101 during regular
business hours (Monday through Friday, 9 a.m. to 5 p.m., Eastern Time,
excluding federal holidays).

 

Please refer to your assigned JMD FOIA TRACKING NUMBER listed above
whenever you contact the Department regarding this request.

 

Sincerely,

  

Karen E. McFadden

FOIA Contact

Justice Management Division

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #15-226
communications.communication:
Why have I yet to receive a legally mandated response to this request under 5 U.S.C. § 552? It's pretty basic! Do you assume I have no interest?

YES. MY INTEREST CONTINUES UNTO THE HEAT DEATH OF THE UNIVERSE. EOM.

Best regards,
   Martin Peck

communications.subject: RE: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #15-226 (JMD FOIA 105661)
communications.communication:
March 13, 2025

VIA EMAIL

Martin Peck
MuckRock News
DEPT MR 21358
263 Huntington Ave
Boston, MA 02115

RE: JMD FOIA # 105661

Dear Martin Peck:

Your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request, dated September 19, 2015, to the National Security Division (NSD) sought for records associated with self-inspection of classified materials handling performed by the DOJ for the last six (6) years including results of inspection and guidance
resulting from analysis. NSD identified eight records of interest to the Justice Management Division (JMD) and referred them to the JMD FOIA Office on April 8, 2016 for a determination regarding their release.  We reviewed these records and are releasing them to you in full.

If you need further assistance or want to discuss your request, please contact JMD’s public FOIA liaison, Daniel Wagner, at (202) 616-0253 or JMDFOIA@usdoj.gov<mailto:JMDFOIA@usdoj.gov>.  Additionally, you may contact the Office of Government Information Services (OGIS) at the National Archives and Records Administration to inquire about FOIA mediation services.  The contact information for OGIS is: Office of Government Information Services, National Archives and Records Administration, 8601 Adelphi Road-OGIS, College Park, MD 20740-6001; email ogis@nara.gov; telephone (202) 741-5770 or toll-free (877) 684-6448; facsimile (202) 741-5769.

If you are not satisfied with JMD’s determination in response to your request, you may administratively appeal by writing to: Director, Office of Information Policy (OIP), U.S. Department of Justice, 441 G Street, NW, 6th Floor, Washington, D.C. 20530, or you may submit an appeal through OIP’s FOIA STAR portal by creating an account following the instructions on OIP’s website (https://www.justice.gov/oip/submit-and-track-request-or-appeal).  Your appeal must be postmarked or electronically transmitted within 90 days of the date of this letter.  If you submit your appeal by mail, both the letter and the envelope should be clearly marked “Freedom of Information Act Appeal.”

Sincerely,


Daniel Wagner
FOIA Service Center
Justice Management Division
U.S. Department of Justice

title: 2010 and 2011 Crime Incidents Request (Oklahoma City Police Department)

communications.subject: Oklahoma Open Records Act Request: 2010 and 2011 Crime Incidents Request (Oklahoma City Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Oklahoma Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting data on crime incidents—those classified by your agency as crimes—rather than calls for service or unfounded incidents.
• Year(s) Requested: 2010 and 2011
• Columns Requested: Incident date, Incident time, Type of crime (e.g., robbery, theft, etc.), Incident ID, and all other available columns that do not require additional processing by the agency or redaction.

If the data are stored in a proprietary or custom electronic format not publicly available, I request that it be converted to a format viewable with standard software, such as Microsoft Excel or CSV. Please avoid providing data in PDF or paper printouts.

This request is made to support academic research conducted in the public interest and is not for commercial purposes. The data will contribute to a research project assessing the effect of music concerts on crime, aiming to enhance public understanding of how large events influence community safety.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Kristina Block

title: Terry Sanford

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Terry Sanford
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records relating to, mentioning, or generated as a result of investigation or inquiry into James Terry Sanford (August 20, 1917 - April 18, 1998), who served as governor of North Carolina from 1961 to 1965 and in the Senate from 1986 to 1993. Sanford was also briefly employed as as Special Agent of the FBI from 1941 to 1942, prior to enlisting with the Army. Proof of death is not required as his date of birth was over 100 years ago.

Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records for all relevant names, individuals, agencies and companies. This is also to include any responsive records held in offsite locations, such as the Alexandria Records Center. Please include both investigatory and non-investigatory records in your search. If any potentially responsive records have been destroyed and/or transferred to NARA, then I request copies of the destruction or transfer slips as well as any other documentation relating to, mentioning or describing said transfer or destruction, to include but not be limited to confirmation that the Bureau has no other copies of said records. If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Paul Galante

Supporting documentation **

Please be advised that efoia@subscriptions.fbi.gov is a no-reply email
address. Questions regarding your FOIA request may be directed to
foipaquestions@fbi.gov. If you have received a FOIPA request number, please
include this in all correspondence concerning your request. Please note eFOIPA
requests are processed in the order that they are received. If you have not
received a FOIPA request number, your request is in the process of being
opened at which time it will be assigned a FOIPA request number and
correspondence will be forthcoming.

** 

Upon receipt of your FOIPA request number, you may check the status of your
FOIPA request on the FBI’s electronic FOIA Library (The Vault) on the FBI’s
public website, http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on the ‘Check Status of Your
FOI/PA Request tool’ link. Status updates are performed on a weekly basis. If
you receive a comment that your FOIPA request number was not located in the
database, please check back at a later date.

I wanted to follow up on the following Freedom of Information Act request, copied below, and originally submitted on Dec. 1, 2021. Please let me know when I can expect to receive a response.  You had assigned it reference number #1511210-000.

Thanks for your help, and let me know if further clarification is needed.

communications.subject: RE: [EXTERNAL EMAIL] -  RE: Freedom of Information Act Request #1511210-000
communications.communication:
Good morning,

Thank you for contacting foipaquestions@fbi.gov.  Please check the status of your FOIPA Request at http://vault.fbi.gov by clicking on "Check Status of Your FOI/PA Request" on the right side of the page, and follow the instructions below.

Check the Status of Your FOIPA Request
If your FOIPA Number is [1234567-0] please enter [1234567-000] into the system. If your FOIPA Number is [1234567-1] please enter [1234567-001] into the system. If you have any questions about the status of your FOIPA request, please e-mail foipaquestions@fbi.gov.

FIND STATUS OF FOIPA- Request statuses are updated weekly

Please enter the whole FOIPA number-Example: [1234567-000]

FOIPA:
Results will show the Request Number, Case Type and Process Description shown below:
FOIPA:
1234567-000

Case Type:
FOIPA

Process Description (Will display the current progress of the request)
The FBI's FOIPA Program is searching the FBI's indices for potentially responsive documents.
You may be contacted via formal letter for all fees and/or negotiation issues that may apply.

NOTE: Recent requests are entered into the FOIPA database in the order that they are received. Before you can check the status, you must have received correspondence assigning a FOIPA request number and the information transferred to the online database. Status information is updated weekly. If a request has been closed within the last six months the online database will display the following: The FOIPA number entered has been closed, and appropriate correspondence has been sent to the address on file.

Estimated Dates of Completion
Requests are processed in the order in which they are received through our multi-track processing system.  Requests are divided into two primary tracks--simple (under 50 pages of potentially responsive documents) and complex (over 50 pages of potentially responsive documents).  Complex requests are further divided into medium, large, and extra-large sub-tracks based upon request size.  Simple track requests typically require the least amount of time to process.  Currently, simple track cases average approximately 111 days from the date of receipt for processing.  Our complex requests in the medium processing track are currently averaging 895 days, large processing track are currently averaging approximately 1,929 days, and extra-large processing track are currently averaging 2,360 days for processing.

Respectfully,

Public Information Officer
FBI - Information Management Division
200 Constitution Drive
Winchester, VA  22602
O: (540) 868-4593
E: foipaquestions@fbi.gov<mailto:foipaquestions@fbi.gov>

Do you have further questions about the FOI/PA process? Visit us at http://www.fbi.gov/foia

Please check the status of your request online at https://vault.fbi.gov/fdps-1/@@search-fdps    Status updates are performed on a weekly basis.

Note:  This is a non-emergency email address.  If this is an emergency, please call 911 directly.  If you need to report a tip for immediate action, please contact FBI Tips at http://tips.fbi.gov/ or reach out to your local field office.

title: Shooting of a dog by Irondequoit, NY police department

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Shooting of a dog by Irondequoit, NY police department
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

Copies of any and all records, including without limitation all email correspondence sent to or from any email address within the @irondequoit.gov domain, referencing or pertaining to the police shooting of a dog on January 10, 2025.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brad Aaron

title: Complaints received through CBP Complaint System

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Request: Complaints received through CBP Complaint System
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

This is a request under the Freedom of Information Act.  I hereby request the following records:

All complaints and allegations by individuals in CBP custody made through the CBP Complaint System from 2012 to the present (end of 2017).

Page 10 of the "May 2014 through December 2015 Sexual abuse and Assault in Holding Facilities Report" states that:

"CBP has improved the CBP public complaint system that
serves as an alternative method for individuals in CBP custody to report detention related
concerns, including allegations of sexual abuse and assault, directly to CBP. A Spanish
language complaint mechanism is now available on CBP.gov called “Comunicarse con
Nosotros” which allows for direct submission of complaints in Spanish. The CBP Info
Center administers the program and has dedicated Spanish speaking personnel to process
the complaints and route appropriately."

Please include complaints filed in Spanish through this new complaint mechanism.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.


Sincerely,

Silvia Vinas

communications.communication:
Office of Commissioner has no documents to support complaints and allegations by individuals in CBP custody made through the CBP Complaint System from 2012 to the present (end of 2017).
 **Suggest you check with PDO/OBP.

Cath
Catherine Waltersdorff
Office of the Executive Secretariat
Office of the Commissioner
U.S. Customs and Border Protection

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Request #CBP-2018-018173
communications.communication:
Hi Catherine,

Thank you for your response. I don't understand your suggestion to check with PDO/OBP. Can you be more specific? If you are suggesting that I forward this request to another office, can you please specify which office that would be? If it is inside CPB, shouldn't this request be moved there internally? Thank you for your time.

Sincerely,
Silvia Viñas

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Request #CBP-2018-018173
communications.communication:
Hi Silvia – I’m sorry. (PDO)Privacy and Diversity Office and (OBP) Office of Border Patrol.
My FOIA requests come from a FOIA Agent via FOIAOnline. It is up to the them to assign.


Cath
Catherine Waltersdorff
Office of the Executive Secretariat
Office of the Commissioner
U.S. Customs and Border Protection

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Request #CBP-2018-018173

communications.subject: RE: Freedom of Information Act Request: Complaints received through CBP Complaint System
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

I am writing to appeal the decision to close this request due to the Office of Commissioner not having the information I've requested. As stated in my request, page 10 of the "May 2014 through December 2015 Sexual abuse and Assault in Holding Facilities Report" states that:

"CBP has improved the CBP public complaint system that serves as an alternative method for individuals in CBP custody to report detention related concerns, including allegations of sexual abuse and assault, directly to CBP. A Spanish language complaint mechanism is now available on CBP.gov called “Comunicarse con Nosotros” which allows for direct submission of complaints in Spanish. The CBP Info Center administers the program and has dedicated Spanish speaking personnel to process the complaints and route appropriately."

Furthermore, the CBP website (https://www.cbp.gov/travel/customer-service/handle-complaints) indicates that "The INFO Center tracks and records complaint or compliment information in an automated tracking system to ensure a proper review of all issues raised by the complainant." And this article refers to a FOIA request which shows the complaints received by the CBP INFO Center: http://securitydebrief.com/2015/10/21/foia-request-delivers-new-cbp-data-on-customer-complaints-compliments/

Please direct this and my original request to CBP's  Privacy and Diversity Office, or the office that oversees the INFO Center.

Sincerely,

Silvia Vinas

communications.subject: CBP-2018-018173 Status Letter
communications.communication:
Silvia Vinas 411A Highland Avenue Somerville MA 02144-2516 

10/29/2018 
CBP-OC-2018-018173 Dear Silvia Vinas 
The U.S. Customs and Border Protection (CBP) Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) Division received your letter inquiring about a FOIA request that you previously submitted to CBP reference FOIA number CBP-OC-2018-018173. 
This letter is to confirm that your FOIA request has been received by CBP and will be processed in the order it was received.  Once responsive records are available, you will be notified electronically by CBP FOIA that records are available to view via your FOIAonline account.  If you already have a FOIAonline account, you can view or print responsive records from your account.  If you do not already have a FOIAonline account, please create one by taking the following steps: 

  * Simply go to your search engine (i.e., google, etc.) and type FOIAonline, then hit enter, that will take you to the FOIAonline site. 
  * From there, press the button on the right “Create Account” and follow the prompts to create a FOIAonline account. 
Submitting a FOIA request online is the preferred method (vs. postal mail) for many reasons: 
  * You immediately receive a unique FOIA tracking number and acknowledgment that your FOIA request was received by CBP. 
  * You can track your FOIA request any day/any time through your FOIAonline account. 
  * When responsive records become available, you receive an email letting you know records can be viewed via your FOIAonline account, 
  * You can view all of your historical FOIA requests via the “dashboard” in your FOIAonline account. 
In the future, please use your FOIAonline account to submit future FOIA requests to CBP.  Please note that all FOIA requests for official travel records on an individual must include 1) the subject’s name, 2) the subject’s date of birth, and 3) third party consent.  If this information is not provided with the original FOIA request, it will be considered “insufficient”, and will not be processed. 
Finally, the CBP FOIA office has a significant backlog of FOIA requests.  The expected response time for a FOIA request for travel documents is 3-6 months.   If you do not receive a response to your FOIA request within 20 business days, please do not resubmit the same FOIA request as it creates further delays.  We are working very hard to clear the FOIA backlog and we thank you in advance for your cooperation. 

CBP FOIA Division

files.title: Status letter Letter

communications.subject: Narrow the Scope
communications.communication:
Silvia Vinas 
N/A 
DEPT MR 46484 411A Highland Ave Somerville MA 02144 
11/08/2018 
CBP-2018-091013 
Dear Silvia Vinas, 
After careful review of your FOIA request,  CBP-2018-091013, we have determined that your request is too broad in scope or did not specifically identify the records which you are seeking. FOIA is not a search mechanism.  Records must be described in reasonably sufficient detail to enable government employees who are familiar with the subject area to locate records without placing an unreasonable burden upon the agency.  For this reason, §5.3(b) of the DHS regulations, 6 C.F.R. Part 5, require that you describe the records you are seeking with as much information as possible to ensure that our search can locate them with a reasonable amount of effort. 
The FOIA does not require an agency to create new records, answer questions posed by requesters, or attempt to interpret a request that does not identify specific records. 
This is not a denial of your request for records. Please resubmit your FOIA request, along with a more detailed description of the records being sought, by logging into your existing FOIAOnline account or creating an account at https://foiaonline.gov. (https://foiaonline.regulations.gov/) 
Sincerely, 
U.S. Customs and Border Protection

communications.subject: CBP FOIA - CBP-2018-018173
communications.communication:
Silvia Vinas 
411A Highland Avenue 
Somerville, Massachusetts 02144-2516 

08/15/2024 

CBP-2018-018173 

Dear Silvia Vinas, 

This is just a short note to inform you of the status of your request.  Please see the bullet checked below for information regarding your request to U.S. Customs and Border Protection (CBP): 

[ ] We are still conducting searches for records which may be responsive to your request. 

[ ]  The custodians most likely to hold your records have been identified and your request has been tasked for search.  Once the volume of documents has been determined, we will reach out to better target your request so we may process it in the most efficient and expeditious manner possible. 

[X]  Records responsive to your request have been identified and we are currently conducting our review.  You will be notified when your records are ready for release. 

[ ]  We would like to update you that your request has moved to the next stage in processing and records are currently being reviewed by our component offices. We anticipate that the records will be ready for release shortly. You will be notified via email when your records are available for viewing. 

Although CBP is working hard to reduce our backlog, if your request included a search for emails, please be advised that requests of this type are typically taking 12 to 24 months to process.  Thank you for your patience while we continue to work on reducing our backlog. 

If you wish to discuss your request in more detail, or at any time you wish to withdraw your request, please call our Public Liaison at 202-325-0150 and reference your request number. 

Please note that this message has been sent from an unmonitored e-mail account. Any messages sent to this account will not be read. 

Sincerely, 

U.S. Customs and Border Protection

title: Broward County police disciplinary files

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Broward County police disciplinary files
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

- Any and all lists, spreadsheets or other organized datasets that detail potential or substantiated allegations of misconduct and/or impeached or impeachable testimony, created under Brady v. Maryland and/or Giglio v. United States.
- Any and all records regarding substantiated allegations of misconduct or violations of internal department policy or criminal law by specific law enforcement officers.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Dillon Bergin

communications.subject: RE: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Broward County police disciplinary files

In regards to items 2, each file that is applicable to your request would need to be manually pulled and reviewed for any potential exemptions and/or redactions that may be necessary. This task will be very time consuming and would require a deposit. Please advise if you would like us to send you a deposit letter.


Thank you
Misty Williams-Bernabe

communications.subject: Welcome to the Open Records Request Portal!
communications.communication:
Dear Bernadette  Feazell, 
 
Thank you for registering with the Open Records Request Portal.

title: Department of Education Letters to 60 Universities and Colleges (University of California, San Diego)

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Department of Education Letters to 60 Universities and Colleges (University of California, San Diego)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

A copy of the letter sent to your institution by the United States Department of Education on or about March 10, 2025, referencing Title VI. The letter is referenced in this press release: https://www.ed.gov/about/news/press-release/us-department-of-educations-office-civil-rights-sends-letters-60-universities-under-investigation-antisemitic-discrimination-and-harassment.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

title: Agency Roster (Oakland Police Department)

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Agency Roster (Oakland Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Please provide records sufficient to show a current staff roster of all sworn employees with your agency.

Please include;
- first and last name of each employee with their corresponding;
- badge number
- employee identification number
- hire date
- rank or position
- assigned duty station/substation/precinct/location
- current salary

This request applies to ALL sworn Department employees, including those at substations.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Marcus Boyd
